onCreate.desc: Called once the script was initialized.

onCreatePost.desc: Called once the game has finished loading.

onDestroy.desc: Called once the script is destroyed.

onBeatHit.desc: Called every beat, use `curBeat` to get the current beat.

onStepHit.desc: Called every step, use `curStep` to get the current step.

onSectionHit.desc: Called every section, use `curSection` to get the section index.

onUpdate.desc:
Called every frame before any logic updates.  
`elapsed` - the time between frames in seconds.

onUpdatePost.desc:
Called every frame after all logic updated.  
`elapsed` - the time between frames in seconds.

onUpdateScore.desc: Triggered every time score text updates.

onSongStart.desc: Triggered once the song starts playing.

onMoveCamera.desc:
Called whenever camera tries to change focus.  
`focus` - character it focuses on, can be either `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`.

onRecalculateRating.desc:
Called right before the rating calculation.  
`return Function_Stop` prevents it from being calculated.

onCountdownTick.desc:
Fires every countdown tick.  
`counter` - number value between 0 and 4.  
` 0 ` - "Three". ` 1 ` - "Two / Ready?".  
` 2 ` - "One / Set". ` 3 ` - "Three / GO!".  
` 4 ` - Song started.

onNextDialogue.desc: Triggered when the next dialogue is called.

onSkipDialogue.desc: Triggered when the dialogue is skipped mid text.

onGameOver.desc:
Triggered before Game Over initialized.  
`return Function_Stop` can be used to prevent it.

onGameOverStart.desc: Triggered after Game Over screen was created.

onGameOverConfirm.desc: Triggered if player decides to retry or return to the menu.

onCustomSubstateCreate.desc:
Same as onCreate() but for substates.  
`name` - the name that was given to the substate using `openCustomSubstate(name)`.

onCustomSubstateUpdate.desc:
Same as onUpdate() but for substates.  
`name` - the substate name.  
`elapsed` - the time between frames in seconds.

onCustomSubstateDestroy.desc:
Triggered when substate closes.  
`name` - the name of the substate that is being closed.

goodNoteHit.desc:
Called when player hits a note.  
`index` - the note's id in unspawnNotes group.  
`noteDir` - 0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.  
`noteType` - type of the custom note.  
`isSustainNote` - true if it's a note's tail part.

opponentNoteHit.desc:
Called when opponent hits a note.  
`index` - the note's id.  
`noteDir` - 0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.  
`noteType` - type of the custom note.  
`isSustainNote` - true if it's a note's tail part.

onSpawnNote.desc:
Called when a note is spawned.  
`index` - the note's id.  
`noteDir` - 0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.  
`noteType` - type of the custom note.  
`isSustainNote` - true if it's a note's tail part.

noteMiss.desc:
Called when player misses a note.  
`index` - the note's id.  
`noteDir` - 0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.  
`noteType` - type of the custom note.  
`isSustainNote` - true if it was a note's tail part.

noteMissPress.desc:
Called when player misses by tapping while ghost tapping is off.  
`noteDir` - 0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.

onKeyPress.desc:
Called when player hits a key.  
`key` - corresponds to the note's direction,  
0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.

onKeyRelease.desc:
Called when player releases a key.  
`key` - corresponds to the note's direction,  
0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.

onGhostTap.desc:
Called when player ghost-taps a key.  
`key` - corresponds to the note's direction,  
0: left, 1: down, 2: up, 3: right.

onTimerCompleted.desc:
Triggered on timer completion.  
`tag` - the tag that was given to the timer.  
`loops` - the amount of loops it have went through.  
`loopsLeft` - the amount of loops left.

onTweenCompleted.desc:
Triggered once any tween completes.  
`tag` - the tag that was given to the tween.

onSoundFinished.desc:
Triggered once any sound finishes.  
`tag` - the tag that was given to the sound.

defaultPlayerStrumX0.desc: Default horizontal position of the player's left note.

defaultPlayerStrumX1.desc: Default horizontal position of the player's down note.

defaultPlayerStrumX2.desc: Default horizontal position of the player's up note.

defaultPlayerStrumX3.desc: Default horizontal position of the player's right note.

defaultPlayerStrumY0.desc: Default vertical position of the player's left note.

defaultPlayerStrumY1.desc: Default vertical position of the player's down note.

defaultPlayerStrumY2.desc: Default vertical position of the player's up note.

defaultPlayerStrumY3.desc: Default vertical position of the player's right note.

defaultOpponentStrumX0.desc: Default horizontal position of the opponent's left note.

defaultOpponentStrumX1.desc: Default horizontal position of the opponent's down note.

defaultOpponentStrumX2.desc: Default horizontal position of the opponent's up note.

defaultOpponentStrumX3.desc: Default horizontal position of the opponent's right note.

defaultOpponentStrumY0.desc: Default vertical position of the opponent's left note.

defaultOpponentStrumY1.desc: Default vertical position of the opponent's down note.

defaultOpponentStrumY2.desc: Default vertical position of the opponent's up note.

defaultOpponentStrumY3.desc: Default vertical position of the opponent's right note.

playbackRate.desc: The current playback speed of the song.

addAnimation.desc:
Adds an animation to the object using indexes.  
`tag` - animated sprite to add animation to.  
`name` - animation name.  
`frames` - table of indexes for animation (ex: `{1, 2, 3, 4, 5}`).  
`loop` - whether to loop the animation or not.

addAnimationByIndices.desc:
Adds an animation to the object using animation prefix and indexes.  
`tag` - animated sprite to add animation to.  
`name` - animation name.  
`indices` - string of indices for animation (ex: `"1, 2, 3, 4, 5"`).  

To add looping animation instead, use `addAnimationByIndicesLoop` function.

addAnimationByIndicesLoop.desc:
Adds a looped animation to the object using animation prefix and indexes.  
`tag` - animated sprite to add animation to.  
`name` - animation name.  
`indices` - string of indices for animation (ex: `"1, 2, 3, 4, 5"`).  

To add non-looping animation instead, use `addAnimationByIndices` function.

addAnimationByPrefix.desc:
Adds an animation to the object using animation prefix.  
`tag` - animated sprite to add animation to.  
`name` - animation name.  
`prefix` - animation prefix in the `.xml` file. `loop` - whether to loop the animation or not.

addCharacterToList.desc:
Preloads the character.  
`name` - the name of the character's .json file.  
`type` - type of the character, can be `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

addHaxeLibrary.desc:
Adds haxe library to hscript (`runHaxeCode` function).  
`libName` - name of the haxe library.  
`libPackage` - path to the haxe package.

addHealth.desc:
Adds `value` to health.  
Keep in mind that health ranges from 0 to 2, 1 being half of the health bar.

addHits.desc: Adds hits and recalculates the rating.

addLuaScript.desc:
Adds a lua script to the execution queue.  
`luaFile` - path to the lua file starting from the `mods/` folder.

addLuaSprite.desc:
Adds lua sprite to the scene.  
`tag` - name of the sprite.  
`front` - whether to add it in front of characters or behind.

addLuaText.desc:
Adds text to the scene.  
`tag` - name of the text object.

addMisses.desc: Adds misses and recalculates the rating.

addOffset.desc: Adds offset to the sprite's animation. `tag` - the sprite's name to add offset to.

addScore.desc: Adds score and recalculates the rating.

anyGamepadJustPressed.desc: Checks if the gamepad's button just got pressed.

anyGamepadPressed.desc: Checks if the gamepad's button is held.

anyGamepadReleased.desc: Checks if the gamepad's button just got released.

callOnLuas.desc: Calls an event in every lua script.

callScript.desc: Calls an event in a specified lua script.

cameraFlash.desc:
Flashes the camera with the specified color.  
`camera` - the camera to flash, either `game`, `hud` or `other`.  
`color` - the hex color value formatted as `0xAARRGGBB` or `RRGGBB`.  
`duration` - the time it takes for flash to fade out.  
`forced` - whether to reset the flash and start over or skip if it's still active.

cameraFade.desc:
Fills the camera with the specified color.  
`camera` - the camera to fill, either `game`, `hud` or `other`.  
`color` - the hex color value formatted as `0xAARRGGBB` or `RRGGBB`.  
`duration` - the time it takes to fade in.  
`forced` - whether to reset the filling and start over or skip if it's still active.

cameraShake.desc:
Shakes the camera.  
`camera` - the camera to shake. Can be either `game`, `hud` or `other`.  
`intensity` - how much the camera shakes.  
`duration` - how much the shake should last.

cancelTimer.desc:
Cancels the timer.  
`tag` - name of the timer to cancel.

cancelTween.desc:
Cancels the tween.  
`tag` - name of the tween to cancel.

changePresence.desc:
Changes Discord Presence.  
**Requires some Discord RPC knowledge.**  
**Do not overuse, otherwise you can get rate limited in Discord.**

characterDance.desc:
Plays the character's idle animation.  
`character` - can be either `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

checkFileExists.desc:
Checks if the file or path exists.  
`absolute` - whether to start from the root directory or the `mods/` folder.

debugPrint.desc:
Prints the text on the screen.  
Supports up to 5 args.  
Be aware that it combines all args into one, without adding space between them.

deleteFile.desc: Deletes file from the specified path.

directoryFileList.desc: Lists the files in the specified directory.

doTweenAlpha.desc:
Tweens object's alpha.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`variable` - object to tween.

doTweenAngle.desc:
Tweens object's angle.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`variable` - object to tween.

doTweenColor.desc:
Tweens object's alpha.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`variable` - object to tween.  
`color` - hex value, formatted as either `0xAARRGGBB` or `RRGGBB`.

doTweenX.desc:
Tweens object's X position.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`variable` - object to tween.

doTweenY.desc:
Tweens object's Y position.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`variable` - object to tween.

doTweenZoom.desc:
Tweens the camera zoom.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`camera` - camera to tween.

exitSong.desc: Forces the player out of the song.

getDataFromSave.desc:
Gets data field from the save file.  
Don't forget to use `initSaveData` before trying to do anything.

gamepadAnalogX.desc:
Gets the gamepad's stick X axis value.  
`id` - gamepad's id.  
`leftStick` - whether it's left stick or not.

gamepadAnalogY.desc:
Gets the gamepad's stick Y axis value.  
`id` - gamepad's id.  
`leftStick` - whether it's left stick or not.

gamepadJustPressed.desc:
Tells if gamepad key just got pressed.  
`id` - gamepad's id.  
`key` - name of the key.

gamepadPressed.desc:
Tells if gamepad key is held at the moment.  
`id` - gamepad's id.  
`key` - name of the key.

gamepadReleased.desc:
Tells if gamepad key just got released.  
`id` - gamepad's id.  
`key` - name of the key.

getCharacterX.desc:
Returns the character's X position.  
`type` - either `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

getCharacterY.desc:
Returns the character's Y position.  
`type` - either `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

getColorFromHex.desc: Returns the int color from hex value.

getGlobalFromScript.desc:
Returns the value from another script.  
`lua` - the lua file.  
`value` - the global value in that lua file.

getGraphicMidpointX.desc: Returns the graphic X midpoint of the sprite.

getGraphicMidpointY.desc: Returns the graphic Y midpoint of the sprite.

getHealth.desc: Gets the current health (value from 0 to 2).

getHits.desc: Returns the current hits value on the song.

getMidpointX.desc: Returns the X midpoint of the sprite.

getMidpointY.desc: Returns the Y midpoint of the sprite.

getMisses.desc: Returns the current misses value on the song.

getMouseX.desc:
Returns the X position of the mouse on the specified camera.  
`camera` - either `game`, `hud` or `other`.

getMouseY.desc:
Returns the Y position of the mouse on the specified camera.  
`camera` - either `game`, `hud` or `other`.

getObjectOrder.desc:
Returns the layer position of the object.  
Use `dadGroup`, `gfGroup` and `boyfriendGroup` to get the order of dad, gf and bf respectively.

getPixelColor.desc: Gets the pixel color as an int.

getProperty.desc: Returns the game's or object's property.

getRandomFloat.desc:
Returns random float value.  
`exclude` - string of numbers separated by ` , `.

getRandomInt.desc:
Returns random int value.  
`exclude` - string of numbers separated by ` , `.

getRunningScripts.desc: Returns an array of all active script's directories.

getScore.desc: Gets the song's score in this game and returns it.

getScreenPositionX.desc: Returns the sprite's X position on the screen.

getScreenPositionY.desc: Returns the sprite's Y position on the screen.

getShaderBoolArray.desc: Returns the object's shader bool array.

getShaderFloatArray.desc: Returns the object's shader float array.

getShaderIntArray.desc: Returns the object's shader int array.

getSongPosition.desc: Returns the current song position in milliseconds.

getSoundTime.desc: Returns the sound's time in milliseconds.

getSoundVolume.desc: Returns the volume of the sound from 0 to 1.

getTextSize.desc: Returns the size of the text's string in pixels.

initLuaShader.desc:
Initializes the shader to be ready to use.  
`shader` - name of the shader's `.frag` file.

isRunning.desc: Checks if the specified lua script is active.

keyJustPressed.desc:
Tells if the keybind was just pressed.  
Checkable keybinds:  
`left`, `down`, `up`, `right`, `space`, `accept`, `back`, `pause`, `reset`.

keyPressed.desc:
Tells if the keybind is held.  
Checkable keybinds:  
`left`, `down`, `up`, `right`, `space`, `accept`, `back`, `pause`, `reset`.

keyReleased.desc:
Tells if the keybind was just released.  
Checkable keybinds:  
`left`, `down`, `up`, `right`, `space`, `accept`, `back`, `pause`, `reset`.

keyboardJustPressed.desc:
Tells if the keyboard key was just pressed.  
You can get key names from [here](https://api.haxeflixel.com/flixel/input/keyboard/FlxKey.html).

keyboardPressed.desc:
Tells if the keyboard key is held.  
You can get key names from [here](https://api.haxeflixel.com/flixel/input/keyboard/FlxKey.html).

keyboardReleased.desc:
Tells if the keyboard key was just released.  
You can get key names from [here](https://api.haxeflixel.com/flixel/input/keyboard/FlxKey.html).

loadGraphic.desc:
Loads image into sprite.  
`spr` - sprite to load image into.  
`img` - path to the image.  
`width` and `height` - size of the frame grid. Don't set unless animated.

loadSong.desc:
Tells the game to load into the song.  
`name` - the song's name. Defaults to the current song.  
`diffNum` - difficulty index. Defaults to -1 (current difficulty).

luaSoundExists.desc: Checks if any sound with the specified tag exists.

luaSpriteExists.desc: Checks if any sprite with the specified tag exists.

luaTextExists.desc: Checks if any text object with the specified tag exists.

makeGraphic.desc:
Makes a graphic for the sprite.  
`tag` - sprite's tag.  
`width`, `height` - size of the rectangle.  
`color` - hex color like `0xAARRGGBB` or `RRGGBB`.

makeLuaSprite.desc:
Makes a sprite with the given tag, image and position.  
If sprite with that tag already exists, it gets replaced.  
`image` - path to the image like `bg-stuff/goober`. Leave empty and use **makeGraphic** function if you want to make a rectangle filled with solid color.

makeLuaText.desc:
Creates a label with the given tag, text and position.  
If text with that tag already exists, it gets replaced.  
`width` - text field's width. Setting to 0 makes it dynamic but text cant be aligned.

mouseClicked.desc:
Tells if mouse button just got pressed.  
`btn` - `middle` or `right`, defaults to left.

mousePressed.desc:
Tells if mouse button is held at the moment.  
`btn` - `middle` or `right`, defaults to left.

mouseReleased.desc:
Tells if mouse button just got released.  
`btn` - `middle` or `right`, defaults to left.

noteTweenAlpha.desc:
Tweens the strum's alpha.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`note` - index of the strum.  
0, 1, 2, 3 - opponent.  
4, 5, 6, 7 - player.

noteTweenAngle.desc:
Tweens the strum's angle.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`note` - index of the strum.  
0, 1, 2, 3 - opponent.  
4, 5, 6, 7 - player.

noteTweenDirection.desc:
Tweens the direction from which notes come from.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`note` - index of the strum.  
0, 1, 2, 3 - opponent.  
4, 5, 6, 7 - player.

noteTweenX.desc:
Tweens the strum's X position.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`note` - index of the strum to move.  
0, 1, 2, 3 - opponent.  
4, 5, 6, 7 - player.  
Don't forget to use `defaultPlayerStrumX_` or `defaultOpponentStrumX_`, where `_` is the strum index.

noteTweenY.desc:
Tweens the strum's Y position.  
`tag` - name of the tween.  
`note` - index of the strum.  
0, 1, 2, 3 - opponent.  
4, 5, 6, 7 - player.  
Don't forget to use `defaultPlayerStrumY_` or `defaultOpponentStrumY_`, where `_` is the strum index.

openCustomSubstate.desc: Opens a custom substate with the given name and calls onCustomSubstateCreate(name) function.

pauseSound.desc: Pauses the any sound with the specified tag.

playAnim.desc:
Plays animation on the sprite.  
`obj` - name of the sprite object.  
`name` - name of the animation.  
`forced` - restarts the animation even if it already plays.  
`reverse` - plays the animation frames in reverse order.  
`startFrame` - the frame that animation is going to start from.

playMusic.desc: Plays specified music from the `music/` folder.

playSound.desc:
Plays specified sound from the `sounds/` folder.  
`tag` - name for the sound to use in functions like `pauseSound(tag)`.

precacheImage.desc: Loads image into memory so game doesn't lag if it tries to load it for the first time.

precacheMusic.desc: Loads music into memory so game doesn't lag if it tries to load it for the first time.

precacheSound.desc: Loads sound into memory so game doesn't lag if it tries to load it for the first time.

removeFromGroup.desc:
Removes object from the group.  
`dontDestroy` - keeps object alive in case it's referenced somewhere else.

removeLuaScript.desc: Removes lua script from execution thread.

removeLuaSprite.desc:
Removes sprite with the specified tag.  
`destroy` - destroys the sprite so it can't be reused and cleans up taken memory.

removeLuaText.desc: Removes text with the specified tag.

removeSpriteShader.desc: Removes the shaders applied to the sprite.

runHaxeCode.desc:
Executes haxe code string.  
Use `[[double square brackets]]` for multiline text.  
`return variableHere;` is useful to get the result.

runTimer.desc:
Creates a timer with specified tag, time and loops.  
`loops` - how many times the timer should run. 0 is infinite, defaults to 1.

saveFile.desc:
Saves `content` into file under `path`.  
`absolute` - makes path start from the root directory of the operating system instead of the mods folder.

scaleObject.desc: Sets the object's size multiplier (scales the object, duh).

screenCenter.desc: Centers the object to the screen.

setBlendMode.desc:
Sets the object's blend mode.  
List of the blend modes:  ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``, ``.

setCharacterX.desc:
Sets the X position of the character's group.  
`char` - either `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

setCharacterY.desc:
Sets the Y position of the character's group.  
`char` - either `dad` or `gf`, defaults to boyfriend.

setDataFromSave.desc:
Sets data field in the save file.  
Use `flushSaveData` to save fields.  
Don't forget to use `initSaveData` before trying to do anything.

setGlobalFromScript.desc:
Sets the value in another script.  
`lua` - the lua file.  
`field` - the global variable in that lua file.

setGraphicSize.desc: Sets the object's size in pixels.

setHealth.desc:
Sets the health.  
`val` - value from 0 to 2.

setHealthBarColors.desc:
Sets the HP Bar's colors.  
 `left` - hex color for the opponent.  
`right` - hex color for the player.  
HEX color format can be either `0xAARRGGBB` or `RRGGBB`.

setHits.desc: Sets the hits counter to the new value and recalculates the rating.

setMisses.desc: Sets the misses counter to the new value and recalculates the rating.

setObjectCamera.desc:
Moves object to the specified camera.  
`camera` - either `game`, `hud` or `other`. Defaults to `game`.

setObjectOrder.desc:
Sets the layer position of the object.  
Also check `getObjectOrder` function.

setPropertyFromClass.desc: Sets the property of the class.

setPropertyFromGroup.desc: Sets the property of the class.

setRatingFC.desc: Sets the FC text (Rating: Rating Name (Perc%) **FC Text**).

setRatingName.desc: Sets the rating text (Rating: **Rating Name** (Perc%) FC Text).

setRatingPercent.desc: Sets the accuracy value from 0 to 1 (Rating: Rating Name (**Perc%**) FC Text).

setScore.desc: Sets the score and recalculates the rating.

setScrollFactor.desc:
Sets the object's scroll factor.  
` 0 ` - stays in place, ` 1 ` - follows the camera.

updateHitbox.desc: Updates the hitbox of the object.

updateHitboxFromGroup.desc: Updates the hitbox of the object in the group.

snippets.Disable Auto-Pause: setPropertyFromClass('flixel.FlxG', 'autoPause', false) -- Don't forget to turn it back on with onDestroy callback
